flawed_nl_solution:
The discount for the Delta flight would come to $850 * 0.2 = $<<850*0.2=710>>710.
The final price of the Delta flight would come to $850 - $710 = $<<850-710=140>>140.
The discount of the United flight would come to $1100 * 0.3 = $<<1100*0.3=330>>330.
The final price of the United flight would come to $1100 - $330 = $<<1100-330=770>>770.
The Delta flight would be cheaper than the United flight by $770 - $140 = $<<770-140=630>>630.
#### 630

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 170, not 710. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
